intro: Delissea latibasilaris, commonly known as the broad-base delissea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy bracts that resemble flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a velvety texture. Delissea latibasilaris is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
